title: ExKMC: Expanding Explainable ùëò-Means Clustering
abstract:
Abstract
Despite the popularity of explainable AI, there is limited work on effective methods for unsupervised learning. We study algorithms for kùëòk-means clustering, focusing on a trade-off between explainability and accuracy. Following prior work, we use a small decision tree to partition a dataset into kùëòk clusters. This enables us to explain each cluster assignment by a short sequence of single-feature thresholds. While larger trees produce more accurate clusterings, they also require more complex explanations. To allow flexibility, we develop a new explainable kùëòk-means clustering algorithm, ExKMC, that takes an additional parameter k‚Ä≤‚â•ksuperscriptùëò‚Ä≤ùëòk^{\prime}\geq k and outputs a decision tree with k‚Ä≤superscriptùëò‚Ä≤k^{\prime} leaves. We use a new surrogate cost to efficiently expand the tree and to label the leaves with one of kùëòk clusters. We prove that as k‚Ä≤superscriptùëò‚Ä≤k^{\prime} increases, the surrogate cost is non-increasing, and hence, we trade explainability for accuracy.
Empirically, we validate that ExKMC produces a low cost clustering, outperforming both standard decision tree methods and other algorithms for explainable clustering. Implementation of ExKMC available at https://github.com/navefr/ExKMC.
